video.title: MEAN Stack CRUD Operations - Beginners Tutorial
video.description:
This MEAN stack beginners tutorial shows how to implement CRUD operations from scratch using the MEAN Stack. The app is created using MongoDB, Express, Node.JS and Angular 5.

Code on GitHub: https://github.com/DotnetMob/MEAN-Stack-CRUD-Operations

This tutorial was created by Dotnet Mob. View their channel for more great tutorials: https://goo.gl/hxQ83h

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

replies.author: Ayush Aher
replies.text: @Devstackr  edit the index.html: base url will be / update it to ./

replies.author: Devstackr
replies.text:
For the NodeJS app, all you have to do is run the file using `node <filename>.js` or use a tool like pm2.
For the Angular app - you need to build it using ng build --prod
and then it will compile to a single html file and some css and JS files - those are all static files which can be hosted on any web server (including shared hosts).
I would recommend nginx or apache if you are doing it on your own server :)


Let me know if you require more info or a more detailed explanation - I'm happy to help!
Andy

topLevelComment.author: JC Pandi
topLevelComment.text:
Hi.. I have an issue with the index.js:
TypeError: Router.use() requires middleware function but got a Object
at Object.<anonymous> (C:\crud\crudapp\servercode\index.js:17:5)
I'm stuck with this error....please help

replies.author: 46arran
replies.text:
Hi.
I had the same problem.
In my case the problem was that I was using these statement "app.use('./employees', employeeController);". It must be "app.use('/employees', employeeController);" without the point.
Hope it helps.
